info.title: ImaLink API
info.description: Pure API backend for image gallery and management system

post.description:
Register a new user account

Rate limit: 5 registrations per hour per IP

Args:
    user_data: User registration information
    db: Database session
    
Returns:
    Created user information (without password)
    
Raises:
    HTTPException: If username or email already exists

Login user and return access token

Rate limit: 10 login attempts per minute per IP

Args:
    login_data: User login credentials
    db: Database session
    
Returns:
    Access token and user information
    
Raises:
    HTTPException: If credentials are invalid

get.description:
Get current user's profile information

Args:
    current_user: Current authenticated user
    
Returns:
    Current user's profile information

post.description:
Logout user (placeholder endpoint)

Note: With JWT tokens, logout is typically handled client-side
by removing the token. For server-side token blacklisting,
additional implementation would be needed.

Returns:
    Success message

get.description:
Get current user's profile information

Args:
    current_user: Current authenticated user
    
Returns:
    Current user's profile information with statistics

put.description:
Update current user's profile information

Args:
    user_update: Updated user information
    current_user: Current authenticated user
    db: Database session
    
Returns:
    Updated user information
    
Raises:
    HTTPException: If update fails (e.g., email already exists)

delete.description:
Deactivate current user's account

Args:
    current_user: Current authenticated user
    db: Database session
    
Returns:
    Success message

post.description:
Change current user's password

Args:
    password_data: Current and new password
    current_user: Current authenticated user
    db: Database session
    
Returns:
    Success message
    
Raises:
    HTTPException: If current password is incorrect

Create a new import session (user's reference metadata).

Client has already imported the images - this just records metadata.

get.description: List all import sessions with pagination
Get a specific import session by ID

delete.description:
Delete an import session.

WARNING: This will also delete all images associated with this import session
due to cascade delete. Use with caution.

get.description: List all authors for the current user with pagination

post.description: Create a new author

get.description: Get author by ID
Get development environment status

post.description:
ðŸš¨ DANGER: Reset entire database (development only)

This will delete ALL data in the database!

Parameters:
- confirm: Must be exactly "DELETE_EVERYTHING" to proceed

delete.description:
Clear specific table (development only)

Parameters:
- table_name: Name of table to clear (images, authors, import_sessions)
- confirm: Must be "CLEAR_TABLE" to proceed

get.description: Get current database statistics
Get detailed database schema information

post.description:
ðŸš¨ DANGER: Clear all data from database (development only)

This will delete ALL records from all tables but preserve the schema.
Safer than reset-database as it doesn't drop tables.

get.description: Get paginated list of photos with metadata (user-scoped)

post.description:
Search photos with advanced filtering (user-scoped)

DEPRECATED: This endpoint is maintained for backwards compatibility.
New code should use POST /api/v1/photo-searches/ad-hoc instead.

This endpoint will be removed in a future version.

Create new Photo with initial ImageFile

USE CASE: Uploading a completely new, unique photo
- Hotpreview and exif_dict stored in Photo (visual data)
- ImageFile stores only file metadata
- A new Photo will always be created

WORKFLOW:
1. Validate hotpreview data
2. Generate photo_hothash from hotpreview (SHA256)
3. Check if Photo already exists (if yes â†’ error 409)
4. Create new Photo with visual data
5. Create ImageFile with file metadata
6. Return success response

Returns:
    ImageFileUploadResponse with photo_created=True

Add new ImageFile to an existing Photo

USE CASE: Adding companion files to existing photos
- RAW file for existing JPEG photo
- Different format/resolution of same photo
- Additional file versions

REQUIREMENTS:
- Photo with {hothash} must exist and belong to user
- NO hotpreview or exif_dict (Photo already has these)

WORKFLOW:
1. Validate that Photo with hothash exists
2. Create ImageFile with only file metadata
3. Return success response

Returns:
    ImageFileUploadResponse with photo_created=False

get.description: Get single photo by hash (user-scoped)

delete.description: Delete photo and all associated image files (user-scoped)

get.description: Get hotpreview image for photo

put.description: Upload or update coldpreview for photo

get.description: Get coldpreview image for photo with optional resizing

patch.description:
Apply non-destructive time/location correction to photo

- Send correction data to override EXIF values
- Send `null` to restore original EXIF values
- Original EXIF data in Photo.exif_dict is never modified

Update view correction settings (frontend rendering hints only)

- Send correction data to set rotation, crop, exposure adjustments
- Send `null` to remove all view corrections
- Backend only stores metadata - no image processing

post.description:
Add one or more tags to a photo.

Tags are created automatically if they don't exist.
Duplicate tags are silently skipped.

**Request body:**
```json
{
    "tags": ["landscape", "sunset", "norway"]
}
```

delete.description:
Remove a specific tag from a photo.

The tag itself remains in the database for reuse.
Returns 404 if photo or tag not found.

get.description:
Get the stack containing this photo.

Returns the stack if photo belongs to one, null otherwise.
With one-to-many relationship, each photo can belong to at most one stack.

schema.title: Response Get Photo Stack Api V1 Photos  Hothash  Stack Get

post.description:
Execute an ad-hoc photo search without saving it

This is the primary search endpoint - send PhotoSearchRequest and get results.
Use this for one-time searches or before deciding to save a search.

Create a new saved photo search

Save a search for later reuse. The search_criteria should be a valid
PhotoSearchRequest as a dict.

get.description: List all saved searches for the current user
Get a specific saved search by ID

post.description:
Execute a saved search and return photo results

This will run the saved search criteria and return matching photos.
Updates the last_executed timestamp and result_count for the saved search.

You can override the pagination parameters without modifying the saved search.

Create new photo collection.

- **name**: Collection name (required, 1-255 chars)
- **description**: Optional description
- **hothashes**: Optional initial photos (must exist and belong to user)

get.description:
List all photo collections for current user.

- **skip**: Number of collections to skip (pagination)
- **limit**: Maximum collections to return (max 100)
Get specific collection by ID

patch.description:
Update collection name and/or description.
Does not affect photos in collection.

- **name**: New name (optional)
- **description**: New description (optional)

delete.description:
Delete collection permanently.
Photos themselves are not deleted, only the collection.

post.description:
Add photos to collection (appends to end).

- **hothashes**: List of photo hothashes to add

Duplicates are automatically skipped.
Photos must exist and belong to user.

delete.description:
Remove photos from collection.

- **hothashes**: List of photo hothashes to remove

get.description:
Get actual Photo objects in collection.

- **skip**: Number of photos to skip
- **limit**: Maximum photos to return

Returns photos in collection order.

schema.title: Response Get Collection Photos Api V1 Collections  Collection Id  Photos Get

put.description:
Reorder photos in collection.

- **hothashes**: Complete list of hothashes in new order

Must contain exactly the same hothashes as current collection,
just in different order. First photo becomes cover photo.

post.description:
Remove photos that no longer exist in database.

Returns number of invalid photos removed.

schema.title: Response Cleanup Collection Api V1 Collections  Collection Id  Cleanup Post

get.description:
List all tags for current user with photo counts

**Sort options:**
- `name`: Alphabetical order
- `count`: By number of photos (most used first)
- `created_at`: By creation date

**Order:**
- `asc`: Ascending
- `desc`: Descending

Get tag suggestions for autocomplete (prefix matching)

Results are ordered by photo count (most used first).

put.description:
Rename a tag (applies to all photos using it)

Returns 404 if tag not found or doesn't belong to user.
Returns 409 if new name already exists for user.

delete.description:
Delete a tag completely (removes from all photos)

**Warning:** This action cannot be undone.
The tag will be removed from all photos that have it.

Returns 404 if tag not found or doesn't belong to user.

get.description:
Get paginated list of photo stacks for the current user.

Returns PhotoStack summaries with photo counts but not full photo lists.
Use the detail endpoint to get photo hashes for a specific stack.

post.description:
Create a new photo stack with optional initial photos.

The stack can be created empty and photos added later, or with initial photos.
If photo_hothashes are provided, they will be validated and added to the stack.

get.description: Get detailed information about a specific photo stack including all photo hashes.

put.description:
Update photo stack metadata (cover photo, stack type).

This endpoint only updates metadata - use the photo management endpoints
to add/remove photos from the stack.

delete.description:
Delete a photo stack.

This removes the stack and all photo memberships but does not delete
the actual Photo objects - they remain in the system unchanged.

post.description:
Add a single photo to a photo stack.

If the photo is already in another stack, it will be removed from that stack first.
Each photo can only belong to one stack at a time.

delete.description:
Remove a single photo from a photo stack.

Stack remains even if empty - use DELETE /{stack_id} to delete empty stacks manually.

post.description:
Create a new PhotoText document.

Document types:
- general: Full-featured (headings, paragraphs, lists, images)
- album: Image-focused (only images/collages)
- slideshow: Presentation-style (single images per block)

The content field must be a complete PhotoText JSON document structure.
Images are referenced by hothash (SHA256 from Photo model).

get.description:
List PhotoText documents for the current user.

Supports filtering by:
- document_type: 'general', 'album', or 'slideshow'
- is_published: true/false

Results can be sorted by:
- created_at (default): Timeline/blog order
- updated_at: Recently modified
- title: Alphabetical

Get a single PhotoText document by ID.

Returns the complete document including content JSON.
User can only access their own documents.

put.description:
Update an existing PhotoText document.

All fields are optional - only provided fields will be updated.
User can only update their own documents.

delete.description:
Delete a PhotoText document.

User can only delete their own documents.
This is permanent and cannot be undone.

get.description:
Get database and storage statistics

Returns overview of:
- Table sizes (record count and disk size)
- Cold storage usage
- Total database file size

No authentication required - intended for system monitoring.
Debug endpoint to show all available routes
Simple health check endpoint

ImageFileAddToPhotoRequest.title: ImageFileAddToPhotoRequest
ImageFileAddToPhotoRequest.description:
Request model for adding an ImageFile to an existing Photo

This is used when uploading a companion file (e.g., RAW file for existing JPEG)
or additional format of the same photo. The photo_hothash must be provided
to specify which existing Photo to add this ImageFile to.

NOTE: hotpreview and exif_dict are NOT included since the Photo 
already exists with its visual representation and metadata. This is purely for 
adding file variants.

hotpreview.title: Hotpreview
hotpreview.description: Hotpreview image binary data or Base64 string (required for new Photo)

exif_dict.title: Exif Dict
exif_dict.description: Parsed EXIF metadata as JSON structure (extracted by frontend)

ImageFileNewPhotoRequest.title: ImageFileNewPhotoRequest
ImageFileNewPhotoRequest.description:
Request model for creating a new ImageFile that will create a new Photo

This is used when uploading an image that represents a new, unique photo.
The hotpreview is required and will be used to generate the Photo's hothash.

ImageFileSummary.title: ImageFileSummary
ImageFileSummary.description: Summary of image files associated with a photo

photo_created.title: Photo Created
photo_created.description: Whether a new Photo was created (true) or existing Photo was used (false)

ImageFileUploadResponse.title: ImageFileUploadResponse
ImageFileUploadResponse.description:
Response model for both new-photo and add-to-photo uploads
Contains the created ImageFile and related Photo information

PhotoSearchRequest.title: PhotoSearchRequest
PhotoSearchRequest.description:
Request model for photo search

Search criteria rules:
- All filters are optional (None = ignore this filter)
- Multiple filters are combined with AND logic
- Empty search (all fields None) returns all photos (with pagination)
- tag_ids uses OR logic (photos with ANY of the specified tags)
- For ranges (rating, dates): both min/max are inclusive

photo_hothash.title: Photo Hothash
photo_hothash.description: Photo hash to add to stack
